intro: Prosaptia stellatosetosa, commonly known as the star-setose plant, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, sandy soils. It is notable for its unique setose (bristly) structures that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
